text: Our best performing in terms of CVR was the hellobar bell in the bottom right hand corner. It's super passive though so readers have to choose to click it. When they did click it, it was our best CTR.

text:
Very much so! I've been learning SQL, data modeling, and how to use Looker...mostly because of the product I'm selling, but also, it's fun :slightly_smiling_face: I love being able to write a really simple SQL query to just answer something like "How many new users were added to our free tier last month?" without needing anyone to help me :muscle:

(Also, I'm hiring for a product marketing manager if any data-saavy marketers are interested: <https://jobs.lever.co/fishtownanalytics/635606c2-0e5f-4510-be54-421e7eda916e>)

text: Hey Content Marketers, super curious if anyone has come across or even uses "The 3'H of content" methodology. I used to use this when advising on copy back in day then adapted it for visual content (video, animation and interactive) and still finding actual formalised content strategies a bit of a rarity within internal Mar/comms teams. Do you feel the same, use your own or have a prefered go to strategy when pitching the importance interally? All input appreciated  and comes with a free unredeemable cupcake :slightly_smiling_face:
